001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.BitcoinNetwork;
005import org.bitcoinj.base.DefaultAddressParser;
006import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
007import org.bitcoinj.base.ScriptType;
008import org.bitcoinj.params.BitcoinNetworkParams;
009import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.AddressInfo;
010import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.LoadWalletResult;
011import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.Outpoint;
012import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.SignedRawTransaction;
013import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.UnspentOutput;
014import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
015import org.bouncycastle.util.encoders.Hex;
016import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.bitcoind.BitcoinConfFile;
017import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcStatusException;
018import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
019import org.bitcoinj.base.Coin;
020import org.bitcoinj.crypto.ECKey;
021import org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters;
022import org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash;
023import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
024import org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutPoint;
025import org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput;
026import org.slf4j.Logger;
027import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;

029import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
030import java.io.IOException;
031import java.math.BigInteger;
032import java.net.URI;
033import java.util.HashMap;
034import java.util.List;
035import java.util.Map;
036import java.util.stream.Collectors;

038/**
039 * Extended Bitcoin JSON-RPC Client with added convenience methods.
040 *
041 * This class adds extra methods that aren't 1:1 mappings to standard
042 * Bitcoin API RPC methods, but are useful for many common use cases -- specifically
043 * the ones we ran into while building integration tests.
044 */
045public class BitcoinExtendedClient extends BitcoinClient {
046    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BitcoinExtendedClient.class);
047
048    public static final Address DEFAULT_REGTEST_MINING_ADDRESS = new DefaultAddressParser().parseAddressAnyNetwork("mwQA8f4pH23BfHyy4zf8mgAyeNu5uoy6GU");
049    private static final BigInteger NotSoPrivatePrivateInt = new BigInteger(1, Hex.decode("180cb41c7c600be951b5d3d0a7334acc7506173875834f7a6c4c786a28fcbb19"));
050    private static final String RegTestMiningAddressLabel = "RegTestMiningAddress";
051    public static final String REGTEST_WALLET_NAME = "consensusj-regtest-wallet";
052    private boolean regTestWalletInitialized = false;
053    private /* lazy */ Address regTestMiningAddress;
054
055    public final Coin stdTxFee = Coin.valueOf(10000);
056    public final Coin stdRelayTxFee = Coin.valueOf(1000);
057    public final Integer defaultMaxConf = 9999999;
058    public final long stdTxFeeSatoshis = stdTxFee.getValue();
059
060    public Coin getStdTxFee() {
061        return stdTxFee;
062    }
063
064    public Coin getStdRelayTxFee() {
065        return stdRelayTxFee;
066    }
067
068    public Integer getDefaultMaxConf() {
069        return defaultMaxConf;
070    }
071
072    public BitcoinExtendedClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
073        super(sslSocketFactory, network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
074    }
075
076    @Deprecated
077    public BitcoinExtendedClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, NetworkParameters netParams, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
078        super(sslSocketFactory, netParams.network(), server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
079    }
080
081    public BitcoinExtendedClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
082        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
083    }
084
085    @Deprecated
086    public BitcoinExtendedClient(NetworkParameters netParams, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
087        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), netParams, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
088    }
089
090    public BitcoinExtendedClient(URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
091        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), (Network) null, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
092    }
093
094    public BitcoinExtendedClient(RpcConfig config) {
095        this(config.network(), config.getURI(), config.getUsername(), config.getPassword());
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Constructor that uses bitcoin.conf to get connection information (Incubating)
100     */
101    public BitcoinExtendedClient() {
102        this(BitcoinConfFile.readDefaultConfig().getRPCConfig());
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Incubating: clone the client with a new base URI for a named wallet.
107     * @param walletName wallet name
108     * @param rpcUser username must be provided because it is not accessible in the parent class
109     * @param rpcPassword password must be provided because it is not accessible in the parent class
110     * @return A new client with a baseURI configured for the specified wallet name.
111     */
112    public BitcoinExtendedClient withWallet(String walletName, String rpcUser, String rpcPassword) {
113        return new BitcoinExtendedClient(this.getNetwork(), this.getServerURI().resolve("/wallet/" + walletName), rpcUser, rpcPassword);
114    }
115
116    public synchronized Address getRegTestMiningAddress() {
117        if (getNetwork() != BitcoinNetwork.REGTEST) {
118            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Operation only supported in RegTest context");
119        }
120        if (regTestMiningAddress == null) {
121            if (!regTestWalletInitialized) {
122                initRegTestWallet();
123            }
124            // If in the future, we want to manage the keys for mined coins on the client side,
125            // we could initialize regTestMiningKey from a bitcoinj-generated ECKey or HD Keychain.
126            try {
127                ECKey notSoPrivatePrivateKey = ECKey.fromPrivate(NotSoPrivatePrivateInt, false);
128                Address address = notSoPrivatePrivateKey.toAddress(ScriptType.P2PKH, BitcoinNetwork.REGTEST);
129                AddressInfo addressInfo = getAddressInfo(address);
130                if (addressInfo.getIsmine() && !addressInfo.getIswatchonly() && addressInfo.getSolvable()) {
131                    log.warn("Address with label {} is present in server-side wallet", RegTestMiningAddressLabel);
132                    regTestMiningAddress = address;
133                } else {
134                    // Import known private key with label and rescan the blockchain for any transactions from
135                    // previous test runs, rescan shouldn't take too long on a typical RegTest chain
136                    log.warn("Adding private key for {} and rescanning chain", RegTestMiningAddressLabel);
137                    importPrivKey(notSoPrivatePrivateKey, RegTestMiningAddressLabel, true);
138                    regTestMiningAddress = address;
139                }
140                log.warn("Retrieved regTestMiningAddress = {}", regTestMiningAddress);
141            } catch (IOException e) {
142                log.error("Exception while checking/importing regTestMiningAddress", e);
143                throw new RuntimeException(e);
144            }
145        }
146        return regTestMiningAddress;
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Initialize a server-side wallet for RegTest mining and test transaction funding. Creates a non-descriptor wallet
151     * with name {@link #REGTEST_WALLET_NAME} if it doesn't already exist.
152     */
153    public synchronized void initRegTestWallet() {
154        if (!regTestWalletInitialized) {
155            // Create a named wallet for RegTest (previously we used the default wallet with an empty-string name)
156            int bitcoinCoreVersion = getServerVersion();
157            try {
158                List<String> walletList = listWallets();
159                if (!walletList.contains(REGTEST_WALLET_NAME)) {
160                    createRegTestWallet(bitcoinCoreVersion, REGTEST_WALLET_NAME);
161                }
162            } catch (IOException ioe) {
163                throw new RuntimeException(ioe);
164            }
165            regTestWalletInitialized = true;
166        }
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Create a server-side wallet suitable for RegTest mining/funding, defaulting all other parameters.
171     * @param bitcoinCoreVersion Used to select correct JSON-RPC parameters to used based on server version
172     * @param name name of wallet to create
173     */
174    private void createRegTestWallet(int bitcoinCoreVersion, String name) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
175        LoadWalletResult result = (bitcoinCoreVersion >= BITCOIN_CORE_VERSION_DESC_DEFAULT)
176                    // Create a (non-descriptor) wallet
177                    ? createWallet(name, false, false, null, null, false, null, null)
178                    : createWallet(name, false, false, null, null);
179        if (result.getWarning().isEmpty()) {
180            log.info("Created REGTEST wallet: \"{}\"", result.getName());
181        } else {
182            log.warn("Warning creating REGTEST wallet \"{}\": {}", result.getName(), result.getWarning());
183        }
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * Generate blocks and funds (RegTest only)
188     *
189     * Use this to generate blocks and receive the block reward in {@code this.regTestMiningAddress}
190     * which can the be used to fund transactions in RegTest mode.
191     *
192     * @param numBlocks Number of blocks to mine
193     * @return list of block hashes
194     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException something broke
195     * @throws IOException something broke
196     */
197    public List<Sha256Hash> generateBlocks(int numBlocks) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
198        return this.generateToAddress(numBlocks, getRegTestMiningAddress());
199    }
200
201    /**
202     * Calculate the subsidy portion block reward for a given height on the current network
203     * @param height the height at which to calculate the mining subsidy
204     * @return mining subsidy
205     */
206    public Coin getBlockSubsidy(int height) {
207        return ((BitcoinNetworkParams) getNetParams()).getBlockInflation(height);
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Returns information about a block at index provided.
212     *
213     * Uses two RPCs: {@code getblockhash} and then {@code getblock}.
214     *
215     * @param index The block index
216     * @return The information about the block
217     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
218     * @throws IOException network error
219     */
220    public Block getBlock(int index) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
221        Sha256Hash blockHash = getBlockHash(index);
222        return getBlock(blockHash);
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Clears the memory pool and returns a list of the removed transactions.
227     *
228     * Note: this is a customized command, which is currently not part of Bitcoin Core.
229     * See https://github.com/OmniLayer/OmniJ/pull/72[Pull Request #72] on GitHub
230     *
231     * @return A list of transaction hashes of the removed transactions
232     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status exception
233     * @throws IOException network error
234     */
235    public List<Sha256Hash> clearMemPool() throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
236        JavaType resultType = mapper.getTypeFactory().constructCollectionType(List.class, Sha256Hash.class);
237        return send("clearmempool", resultType);
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Creates a raw transaction, spending from a single address, whereby no new change address is created, and
242     * remaining amounts are returned to {@code fromAddress}.
243     * <p>
244     * Note: the transaction inputs are not signed, and the transaction is not stored in the wallet or transmitted to
245     * the network.
246     *
247     * @param fromAddress The source to spend from
248     * @param outputs The destinations and amounts to transfer
249     * @return The hex-encoded raw transaction
250     */
251    public String createRawTransaction(Address fromAddress, Map<Address, Coin> outputs) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
252        // Copy the Map (which may be immutable) and add prepare change output if needed.
253        Map<Address, Coin> outputsWithChange = new HashMap<>(outputs);
254        // Get unspent outputs via RPC
255        List<UnspentOutput> unspentOutputs = listUnspent(0, defaultMaxConf, fromAddress);
256
257        // Gather inputs as OutPoints
258        List<Outpoint> inputs = unspentOutputs.stream()
259                .map(this::unspentToOutpoint)
260                .collect(Collectors.toList());
261
262        // Calculate change
263        final long amountIn = unspentOutputs
264                .stream()
265                .map(UnspentOutput::getAmount)
266                .mapToLong(Coin::getValue)
267                .sum();
268        final long amountOut = outputs.values()
269                .stream()
270                .mapToLong(Coin::getValue)
271                .sum();
272
273        // Change is the difference less the standard transaction fee
274        final long amountChange = amountIn - amountOut - stdTxFeeSatoshis;
275        if (amountChange < 0) {
276            // TODO: Throw Exception
277            System.out.println("Insufficient funds"); // + ": ${amountIn} < ${amountOut + stdTxFee}"
278        }
279        if (amountChange > 0) {
280            // Add a change output that returns change to sending address
281            outputsWithChange.put(fromAddress, Coin.valueOf(amountChange));
282        }
283
284        // Call the server to create the transaction
285        return createRawTransaction(inputs, outputsWithChange);
286    }
287
288    /**
289     * Creates a raw transaction, sending {@code amount} from a single address to a destination, whereby no new change
290     * address is created, and remaining amounts are returned to {@code fromAddress}.
291     * <p>
292     * Note: the transaction inputs are not signed, and the transaction is not stored in the wallet or transmitted to
293     * the network.
294     *
295     * @param fromAddress The source to spent from
296     * @param toAddress The destination
297     * @param amount The amount
298     * @return The hex-encoded raw transaction
299     */
300    public String createRawTransaction(Address fromAddress, Address toAddress, Coin amount) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
301        return createRawTransaction(fromAddress, Map.of(toAddress, amount));
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Returns the Bitcoin balance of an address (in the server-side wallet.)
306     *
307     * @param address The address
308     * @return The balance
309     */
310    public Coin getBitcoinBalance(Address address) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
311        // NOTE: because null is currently removed from the argument lists passed via RPC, using it here for default
312        // values would result in the RPC call "listunspent" with arguments [["address"]], which is invalid, similar
313        // to a call with arguments [null, null, ["address"]], as expected arguments are either [], [int], [int, int]
314        // or [int, int, array]
315        return getBitcoinBalance(address, 1, defaultMaxConf);
316    }
317
318    /**
319     * Returns the Bitcoin balance of an address (in the server-side wallet) where spendable outputs have at least
320     * {@code minConf} confirmations.
321     *
322     * @param address The address
323     * @param minConf Minimum amount of confirmations
324     * @return The balance
325     */
326    public Coin getBitcoinBalance(Address address, Integer minConf) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
327        return getBitcoinBalance(address, minConf, defaultMaxConf);
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Returns the Bitcoin balance of an address (in the server-side wallet) where spendable outputs have at least
332     * {@code minConf} and not more than {@code maxConf} confirmations.
333     *
334     * @param address The address (must be in wallet)
335     * @param minConf Minimum amount of confirmations
336     * @param maxConf Maximum amount of confirmations
337     * @return The balance
338     */
339    public Coin getBitcoinBalance(Address address, Integer minConf, Integer maxConf) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
340        return listUnspent(minConf, maxConf, address)
341                .stream()
342                .map(UnspentOutput::getAmount)
343                .reduce(Coin.ZERO, Coin::add);
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Sends BTC from an address to a destination, whereby no new change address is created, and any leftover is
348     * returned to the sending address.
349     *
350     * @param fromAddress The source to spent from
351     * @param toAddress   The destination address
352     * @param amount      The amount to transfer
353     * @return The transaction hash
354     */
355    public Sha256Hash sendBitcoin(Address fromAddress, Address toAddress, Coin amount) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
356        Map<Address, Coin> outputs = Map.of(toAddress, amount);
357        return sendBitcoin(fromAddress, outputs);
358    }
359
360    /**
361     * Sends BTC from an address to the destinations, whereby no new change address is created, and any leftover is
362     * returned to the sending address.
363     *
364     * @param fromAddress The source to spent from
365     * @param outputs     The destinations and amounts to transfer
366     * @return The transaction hash
367     */
368    public Sha256Hash sendBitcoin(Address fromAddress, Map<Address, Coin> outputs) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
369        String unsignedTxHex = createRawTransaction(fromAddress, outputs);
370        SignedRawTransaction signingResult = signRawTransactionWithWallet(unsignedTxHex);
371
372        boolean complete = signingResult.isComplete();
373        assert complete;
374
375        String signedTxHex = signingResult.getHex();
376        Sha256Hash txid = sendRawTransaction(signedTxHex);
377
378        return txid;
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Create a signed transaction locally (i.e. with a client-side key.) Finds UTXOs this
383     * key can spend (assuming they are ScriptType.P2PKH UTXOs)
384     *
385     * @param fromKey Signing key
386     * @param outputs Outputs to sign
387     * @return A bitcoinj Transaction objects that is properly signed
388     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException A JSON-RPC error was returned
389     * @throws IOException            An I/O error occured
390     */
391    public Transaction createSignedTransaction(ECKey fromKey, List<TransactionOutput> outputs) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
392        Address fromAddress = fromKey.toAddress(ScriptType.P2PKH, getNetwork());
393
394        Transaction tx = new Transaction(getNetParams());   // Create a new transaction
395        outputs.forEach(tx::addOutput);                     // Add all requested outputs to it
396
397        // Fetch all UTXOs for the sending Address
398        List<TransactionOutput> unspentOutputs = listUnspentJ(fromAddress);
399
400        // Calculate change (units are satoshis)
401        // First sum all available UTXOs
402        final Coin amountIn = unspentOutputs.stream()
403                .map(TransactionOutput::getValue)
404                .reduce(Coin.ZERO, Coin::add);
405        // Then sum the requested outputs for this transaction
406        final Coin amountOut = outputs.stream()
407                .map(TransactionOutput::getValue)
408                .reduce(Coin.ZERO, Coin::add);
409        // Change is the difference less the standard transaction fee
410        final long amountChange = amountIn.value - amountOut.value - stdTxFeeSatoshis;
411        if (amountChange < 0) {
412            // TODO: Throw Exception
413            System.out.println("Insufficient funds"); // + ": ${amountIn} < ${amountOut + stdTxFeeSatoshis}"
414        }
415        if (amountChange > 0) {
416            // Add a change output that returns change to sending address
417            tx.addOutput(Coin.valueOf(amountChange), fromAddress);
418        }
419
420        // Add *all* UTXOs for fromAddress as inputs (this perhaps unnecessarily consolidates coins, with
421        // a higher tx fee and some loss of privacy) and sign them
422        unspentOutputs.forEach(unspent -> tx.addSignedInput(unspent, fromKey));
423        return tx;
424    }
425
426    /**
427     * Create a signed transaction locally (i.e. with a client-side key.) Finds UTXOs this
428     * key can spend (assuming they are org.bitcoinj.base.ScriptType.P2PKH UTXOs)
429     *
430     * @param fromKey   Signing key
431     * @param toAddress Destination address
432     * @param amount    Amount to send
433     * @return A bitcoinj Transaction objects that is properly signed
434     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException A JSON-RPC error was returned
435     * @throws IOException            An I/O error occured
436     */
437    public Transaction createSignedTransaction(ECKey fromKey, Address toAddress, Coin amount) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
438        List<TransactionOutput> outputs = List.of(
439                new TransactionOutput(getNetParams(), null, amount, toAddress));
440        return createSignedTransaction(fromKey, outputs);
441    }
442
443    /**
444     * Build a list of bitcoinj {@link TransactionOutput}s using {@link BitcoinClient#listUnspent}
445     * and {@link BitcoinClient#getRawTransaction} RPCs.
446     *
447     * @param fromAddress Address to get UTXOs for
448     * @return All unspent TransactionOutputs for fromAddress
449     */
450    public List<TransactionOutput> listUnspentJ(Address fromAddress) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
451        List<UnspentOutput> unspentOutputs = listUnspent(0, defaultMaxConf, fromAddress); // RPC UnspentOutput objects
452        return unspentOutputs.stream()
453                .map(this::unspentToTransactionOutput)
454                .collect(Collectors.toList());
455    }
456
457    /**
458     * Build a list of bitcoinj {@link TransactionOutPoint}s using {@link BitcoinClient#listUnspent}.
459     *
460     * @param fromAddress Address to get UTXOs for
461     * @return All unspent TransactionOutPoints for fromAddress
462     */
463    public List<TransactionOutPoint> listUnspentOutPoints(Address fromAddress) throws JsonRpcStatusException, IOException {
464        List<UnspentOutput> unspentOutputsRPC = listUnspent(0, defaultMaxConf, fromAddress); // RPC UnspentOutput objects
465        return unspentOutputsRPC.stream()
466                .map(this::unspentToTransactionOutpoint)
467                .collect(Collectors.toList());
468    }
469    
470    /**
471     * Convert an {@link UnspentOutput} JSONRPC-POJO to a *bitcoinj* {@link TransactionOutput} (that's out-PUT).
472     * Calls {@link BitcoinClient#getRawTransaction(Sha256Hash)}
473     * for every item. Throws {@link RuntimeException} if any of those RPC calls fails.
474     *
475     * @param unspentOutput The input POJO
476     * @return The *bitcoinj* object  (that's out-PUT)
477     */
478    private TransactionOutput unspentToTransactionOutput(UnspentOutput unspentOutput) {
479        try {
480            return getRawTransaction(unspentOutput.getTxid())
481                    .getOutput(unspentOutput.getVout());
482        } catch (IOException e) {
483            throw new RuntimeException(e);
484        }
485    }
486
487    /**
488     * Convert an {@link UnspentOutput} JSONRPC-POJO to a *bitcoinj* {@link TransactionOutPoint} (that's out-POINT).
489     *
490     * @param unspentOutput The input POJO
491     * @return The *bitcoinj* object  (that's out-POINT)
492     */
493    private TransactionOutPoint unspentToTransactionOutpoint(UnspentOutput unspentOutput) {
494        return new TransactionOutPoint(getNetParams(), unspentOutput.getVout(), unspentOutput.getTxid());
495    }
496
497    /**
498     * Convert an {@link UnspentOutput} JSONRPC-POJO to a JSONRPC-POJO {@link Outpoint} .
499     *
500     * @param unspentOutput The input UnspentOutput POJO
501     * @return the Outpoint POJO
502     */
503    private Outpoint unspentToOutpoint(UnspentOutput unspentOutput) {
504        return new Outpoint(unspentOutput.getTxid(), unspentOutput.getVout());
505    }
506}
